definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: He explained that he was robbing the bank because Santa had to pay his elves.
sentences.chinese: 他竟然说抢银行是为了要给小精灵们付工钱。

sentences.english: I hadn’t been paid for the job yet, obviously, and didn’t have any money.
sentences.chinese: 显然我还没收到工钱，而且我自己也没钱了。

sentences.english: Blue Joe lets what husband's younger sister to wages, begin dibble.
sentences.chinese: 蓝乔让何小姑给了工钱，就开始播种。

sentences.english: The only problem was that Mr. Ballou never seemed to have any money to pay for it.
sentences.chinese: 惟一的问题是，巴卢先生似乎从来没钱支付工钱。

sentences.english: It was too late for Teng De. With his last breath, he told his cousin to pass his wages to his mother.
sentences.chinese: 直到腾德快咽气时，仍嘱咐堂弟把他的工钱交给母亲。

sentences.english: There are climbing high line want back wages, it really is just a joke?
sentences.chinese: 还有爬高压线想要回工钱，难道真的仅是一场儿戏？

sentences.english: They paid the driver the carriage hire.
sentences.chinese: 他们把工钱付给了马车夫。

sentences.english: You earn wages, only to put them in a purse with holes in it.
sentences.chinese: 得工钱的，将工钱装在破漏的囊中。

sentences.english: You earn wages, only to put them in a purse with holes in it.
sentences.chinese: 得工钱的，将工钱装在破漏的囊中。

sentences.english: What those people valued was high wages.
sentences.chinese: 这些人所希罕的就是高工钱。

sentences.english: It goes aganist the grain to have to pay him for such poor work.
sentences.chinese: 为这么简单的工作支付他工钱真是让人不舒服。

sentences.english: Asking only workman's wages, I come looking for a job, but I get no offers.
sentences.chinese: 我去找工作，只要小工的工钱，也没人理我。

sentences.english: Some are not being paid at all.
sentences.chinese: 更何况，有些工人根本拿不到工钱。

sentences.english: They are urgent for payment of arrears of wages.
Pub after closing time, and gave the jade lute eight ocean for wages.
sentences.chinese: 酒馆打烊后，翩翩给了玉琴八个大洋作工钱。

sentences.english: He eked out his wages by working evenings and Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 营造商星期五给他的工人发工钱。

definition: to help with farm work/casual laborer
